DVD 5 (VIDEO TS folder)
Language: English
Audio: Dolby Digital 2.0 Format: MPEG-2 PAL 4:3
Duration. 00:59:01
Subtitles: No
Cover: Yes

Jimi Hendrix - Guitar
Billy Cox - Bass
Mitch Mitchell-Drums

Here is Jimi's performance at the Atlanta Pop Festival on July 4, 1970 in front of an absolutely massive crowd of between 350,000 and 500,000 people (in contrast, had only about 175,000 left fans in the crowd at Woodstock in Jimi moment finally happened).
It should be noted about this program. Jimi is playing with the "Cry of Love" poster of himself, Mitch Mitchell on drums and Billy Cox on bass.
This was not a very happy time in the life of Jimi and I think you can feel it in the performance of the band compared with the looser, more energetic shows became the experience and 68 with the Band of Gypsies in early 1970. Still, it is interesting and important action that any Hendrix fan should have. Another interesting fact: this performance was recorded by a production company that provides for a similar film to the film Woodstock. Unfortunately, the production company went bankrupt a few days after the concert.
The rock guitarist Jimi Hendrix playing live at the Second Atlanta International Pop Festival in 1970.

Intro
Fire
